author: Blade
title: Cut Down to Size.
review:
This set is from a series I was never really able to collect much of. Which I feel is a shame as it seems like a nice underwater series. This model is a kind of Aqua scooter. It has a big spinning circular blade attached to a hinging arm. It also has handles for the mini-fig and a rotor at the back. Model is well designed for cutting through things.

The mini-fig is Ogle, who is all black with shoulder guards and a gold visor for his helmet. He also has a red fluoro hook for a hand and a red bionic eye by the looks of it.This is also one of those sets that comes with a small two page comic at the back of the instruction book. 

The only real let down with this little model is he cant hold onto both the handles of the model at the same time but dose he really need to as his other hand is a hook.

Overall this model is pretty straight forward. Looks intriguing but has very little playability. I feel this model is a 5/10 and is great if you have its other two companions or the rest of the series. Also good for any under water fan.

author: Outcast
title: Great little set!
review:
This is a good set for its size!

Pros:

-Easy way to get Ogel
-Only set with saw in trans red
-Good parts

Cons:

-Could have included a piece of seaweed, or an orb etc.

All in all this a good set for cheap! :)

author: Pepper
title: nothing special
review:
I got this set a few years ago for my b-day. It is an OK set, nothing special, but a good, easy way to get Ogel.

pros:
-Ogel
-the saw is cool, and it spins
-could be used for Rock Raiders or Power Miners

cons:
-none really, except kind of boring on it's own

Overall, this set is pretty much good only if you have other Alpha Team sets. I don't particularly reccommend it, but if you have Ogel's Base, you might want to get it.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Alpha Team - Evil Ogel Attack
review:
The Evil Ogel Attack (4798) is a LEGO Alpha Team set which came out in 2002. It comes with 1 minifig and 21 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/4798-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Ogel: Ogel comes with a black suit, a black armor, a red hook for a hand, a black helmet and a shiny golden visor. On his face you can see a red eye. I think that this is supposed to be blood.

Evil Ogel Attack:

The evil Ogel attack set comes comes with a chainsaw. The saw does spin full 360Â° and you can move the blade up and down and to the left and to the right. On each side you can see a handle where the minifig can hold the chainsaw and on the back you can see a propeller.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifig
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features.

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

author: Squidtron
title: Not Much, Coulda Been Bigger
review:
I got this set a long time ago so I don't remember much about it. 

Here are the cool/not cool things about it.
Saw spins(+1)
Saw arm turns all over the place(+2)
Ogel(+1)
Could've been larger(-1)
 Now the grand total is... 3/5

Not bad but could've been bigger.
